revised_title: Structural Polysaccharides in Algal Cell Walls: Xylan and Mannan in Porphyra umbilicalis
tldr: The authors studied the cell walls of the red alga Porphyra umbilicalis and found that the major structural polysaccharides, xylan and mannan, are spatially segregated within the plant. The cell walls contain microfibrils of xylan, while the cuticle is mainly composed of mannan. The structure of these polysaccharides and their arrangement in the cell walls provide insights into the growth and development of the alga.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Algae Biology
